intro: Sandwithia guyanensis, commonly known as the Guyana sandwithia, is a flowering plant native to South America. It belongs to the Asteraceae family, which includes daisies and sunflowers. The plant is characterized by its erect growth habit and narrow, lance-shaped leaves. It produces small, yellowish flowers arranged in composite heads, typical of the family. Sandwithia guyanensis is often found in open, sunny habitats such as grasslands and disturbed soils.
